item.title: Compact Operators and Spectral Intuition
item.description: Functional analysis has a reputation for being abstract and “soft”. But once you internalise compact operators on Hilbert spaces, a lot of the theory suddenly feels almost finite-dimensional again. This post is a somewhat opinionated walkthrough of: compact operators on Hilbert spaces, the structure of their spectrum, and how to think about them using finite-dimensional approximations and a bit of code. Along the way we’ll sprinkle some numerical experiments and quotes, to make it feel less like lecture notes and more like a working notebook.

item.title: Quotients, Intuitively
item.description: Quotients are one of those ideas that appear everywhere. At a very crude level, a quotient is what you get when you declare some points to be the same. Formally, start with a set $X$ and an equivalence relation $\sim$ on $X$.
